solution_line_template: Two boxes of popcorn cost ${popcorn_price_per_box} x {num_popcorn_boxes} = $<<{popcorn_price_per_box}*{num_popcorn_boxes}={total_popcorn_cost}>>{total_popcorn_cost}.
Three cups of milk tea cost ${milk_tea_price_per_cup} x {num_milk_tea_cups} = $<<{milk_tea_price_per_cup}*{num_milk_tea_cups}={total_milk_tea_cost}>>{total_milk_tea_cost}.

The total expenses for the their tickets and food are ${total_ticket_cost} + ${total_popcorn_cost} + ${total_milk_tea_cost} = $<<{total_ticket_cost}+{total_popcorn_cost}+{total_milk_tea_cost}={total_expenses}>>{total_expenses}.
So, each of them should contribute ${total_expenses}/{num_friends} = $<<{total_expenses}/{num_friends}={contribution_per_person}>>{contribution_per_person}.
